metadata.dc:author: Torregrosa Andrés, A
Pacheco Usmayo, A
Rogel Bertó, R
Luján Marco, S
Flores Méndez, J
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To describe the types of penile prostheses and their components, to review the appropriate magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) acquisition protocol, and to describe the normal imaging findings and possible complications in patients with inflatable penile implants. CONCLUSION Three-piece inflatable penile prostheses are the last link in the treatment chain for erectile dysfunction. They can develop complications, which are classified as non-infectious related to the surgical technique, infectious, or due to mechanical failure of the device. MRI is the most appropriate imaging technique for the postsurgical evaluation of penile prostheses. Images are acquired in three planes using sequences with high spatial resolution, first with the prosthesis at rest and then with the prosthesis activated.

metadata.dc:title: Utilidad de la resonancia magnética en la valoración postquirúrgica de pacientes con prótesis hidráulica de pene.
Usefulness of magnetic resonance imaging in the postsurgical assessment of patients with inflatable penile prostheses.
